text:
Draught @ 8th. BBF 2016 [ 8th Borefts Beer Festival 2016 ] @ Brouwerij de Molen, Bodegraven, Netherlands. [ As Sahtipaja Sahti ].Unclear medium orange color with a small, fizzy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate fruit - banana - old grain - rice - veggies, urth - mesk, herbs, herbal - earthy. Flavor is moderate sweet with a average duration, sweet fruit - banana - veggies, tart - sour, floral - herbal - earthy, old grain - rice. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. IMO ... Odd !! [20160923]
 7-2-7-3-10

Light hazy golden with a very small white head. Aromas of floral, grass, light herbal touch develops. Fine carbonation, light bodied at such abv with a bit of a sharp texture. Light sourness and light spice bitterness develops.

23rd September 2016Borefts VIII. Day 1. Keg. Hazy gold beer, no head. Palate is light and semi dry with reasonable fine carbonation. Light floralness. Spicy generic fruits, slightly sour as well. Modest lemony gueuzy vibe. Light finish. Decent and nice to have a Sahti on tap.

Sample at Borefts 2016. Poured a clear medium amber with little life. The aroma is light banana. The flavour is acid citrus with a light fresh rotting fruit palate. Nothing much to enjoy here Im afraid. Medium bodied with flat carbonation.
Tasted at Borefts Beer Festival 2016. Banana, wheat, fruits, sweet bubblegum.
Bue à la pression au Borefts Beer Festival 2016. Javais dautres choses à faire que de prendre des notes ;)

Draft at Borefts De Molen Beer Festival 2016 Bodegraven, The Netherlands. 23.09.2016. Pour it hazy amber color with no head. Aroma honey, herbal. Taste sweet honey, orange, herbal tea finish, ok interesting, medium body, creamy, average carbonation, bitter finish.

Fruity and light malty, some caramel and honey sweetness, some spice and herbal nuances in play, not really my thing.

23/IX/16 - on tap @ Borefts Bier Festival - BB: n/a (2016-1041) Thanks to the Belgian ratebeer crew for sharing todays beers!
Cloudy pale orange beer, no head. Aroma: grassy, floral, very herbal, green, fruity touch. MF: no carbon, medium body. Taste: funky, bit sourish, malty, grains, weird, slightly smoky. Aftertaste: funky and sourish.

Draught at Borefts Beer Festival 2016.
Hazy amber coloured with a small white head.
Fruity aroma of caramel, spices and earth.
Fruity flavour of caramel, earth and spices.
Spicy finish.
At BBF, quite cloudy orange color, vanila and herbal aroma, bitter and a bit harsh with some hotness, not enough herbal spice character. Really dissapointing, had Much better sahtis.

[9/23/16] Draught sample at Borefts Beer Festival 2016 in Bodegraven. Day one. Cloudy orange. Aroma of fruity esters and juniper. Sweet flavor, very fruity, with a bit of honey, and a light tart hint.
Sampled at Borefts 2016, Bodegraven. Dark orange with no head. Notes of caramel, mashed barley grains, orange zest. Meidum body, light carbonation and a bitter-sweet finish.
draft at BBF, poured deep orange with a small white head on top. nose of sweet caramel, honey, sweer orange, mango, light vanilla, light tart, smoked notes, light maltes, berries.
From tap. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is herbal and slight fruity. Dry. Mild citric and herbal. Dry and bitter, herbal finish.
Keg at borefts... Hazy Amber.. Thin white lacing.. Soft sweet almost smoke fruit nose.. Soft sweet floral fruit.. Orange fruit.? Light cucumber

Draught @ Borefts16: Served in a taster:
Cloudy orange body, no head.
Nose of orange, mango, herbs, spice, cray...
Flavours of spice, sweet orange fruit, light malty, herbal...
Low carbo, light watery mouthfeel, medium bodied
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: At Borefts 2016. Weird aroma of herbs and nettle. Taste is quite strange as well, with herbs, berries, mild vanilla and nettle-ish spices. Weird and only so-so.
Keg @Borefts 2016. Pours amber/orange, no head and hazy. Nose is HB2 pencil, it smells like wood and pencil. Taste is slight juniper, some vegetables but a huge taste of pencil.

On tap at Borefts 2016. Light orange with no head. Aroma is wet straw, spruce tip, juniper, vanilla, lime zest, apple blossom. Light bodied, slightly sticky mouthfeel, fruity on the palate with a dry finish. Taste is apple peel, spruce tip, juniper, lemon zest.
Tap @ Borefts. Blonde, cloudy. Citrus and birch twigs in the aroma. Grainy sweet phenloc flavor with citrus, pear and peach. Complex. Nice.

On tap at Borefts, shared.
No head. Very hazy amber pour. Herbal aftertaste
van tap @Borefts 2016, wazig geel.gouden, aroma en smaken van mout, gist, zuur, fruit, redelijk wat honing, erg floraal, zoet, zacht lage co2, matige body, wazige kruidigheid maar niet slecht

Bue à la pression en 10cl au Borefts de De Molen à Bodegraven
Couleur orange, pas de mousse pas deffervescence
Nez sur le fumé
En bouche attaque fumé salé très sec
At Borefts 2016. thnx for sharing,everyone ! Pours unclear blonde/amber. Smell is sweet (honey ) Taste is sweet, bit bitter, bit malty. Bit plastic factor though.

Full draught [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ 2016 - Day 2. - My first sahti, having been recently baptised with koduolu - tastes familiar: rising bread and pancake dough wrapped in unripe banana peels elevated to sessionable hights through an airy, almost ethereal juniper twig element and a slight, balancing whisp of earthy smoke. Deliciously rural and basic, if hard to rate. - Had this in one hand, Sahtipajas Violmjöd in the other and it was bliss paired with festival chat sat in a De Molen church pew .
Draft at Borefts 2016, Day 1. Cloudy golden with no head. Aroma of old grain, banana and veggies. Moderate sweet and light sour. Light Medium bodied with soft carbonation. [23-09-2016]

Sampled from tap at Borefts 2016. Slightly hazy, golden orange with a white layer. Sweetish, slightly fruity and moderately herbal aroma of peach, honey and some juniper. Sweetish, slightly fruity and a little herbal taste of peach, honey and hints of juniper, followed by a short, slightly bitter, a little herbal finish. Medium body, slightly effervescent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Nice!

Thank you for sharing BE RB Crew! Sampled draft @ Borefts 2016. Day 1. Murky orange with no head. Smells like pencil shaving, faintly sour raw wort, sweet flat hop, barn, oily, Taste is raw barn, wort, pencil shaving, fermenting tasting, toffee, oily, sweet, Little carbonation. Hard to judge very unusual but I got a bit into it after a few tried. Interesting to try to say the least.
Draught at Borefts 16. Somewhat pale golden with no head. Medium body with almost no carbonation. Quite sour with some subtle sweet tones. Tart, spices, yeast and juniper. OK.

23.09.2016, tap @ Borefts:
No head. Aroma is dry yeasty, weeds, yeast, minerals, sour grass, dough, almond essence, bark. Taste is slightly sour-ish dry yeasty, weeds, sour grass, minerals, bark, yeast, dough, juniper. Medium to longlasting, sour-ish mineraly mouthfeel. Not my cup of tea.
Sampled @ Borefts Beer Festival 2016. Trübes orange goldenes Bier mit geringen weißen Schaumkrone. Geruch nach reifen Bananen, süß malzig. Geschmack sehr bananig, reife Früchte, hefig, Kräuter.

Draft @ Borefts 2016.
Orange trouble et foncé, pas de col, présentant un léger trouble.
Arôme offre un bouquet mettant en avant une fermentation spontanée avec des effluves presque de multi-céréales avec un rétro plaisant de sous-bois, marrais, herbe et de genévrier.
Palais est léger, centré sur les grains avec juste ce quil faut de levure sauvage offrant un léger côté ester. Faible en effervescence, pointe abricot, amertume sur la fin avec une pointe damertume. Pas mal, à quasi 8% lalcool pointe légèrement et renforce le côté fruité.
On tap at Borefts. Muddy orange with no head. Aroma of banana and yeast. Dry and tart yeasty flavour

Sampled @ Borefts Beer Festival 2016, Day 1. Hazy yellow to orange color, virtually no head. Quite vegetable aroma. Taste is lightly sour with a distant hint of hops perhaps. A bit weird. Some berries in there as well it seems. Meh.
From tap at Borefts 2016. Aroma is light malty, wheat, fruity notes, bit sweaty, funky-ish with spicy notes. Flavour has a slight touch of sour. Body is medium. Not bad, interesting to drink.

Herbal, humus, light spice, tea, touch woody. Quite flat and not bitter, but thats the style it is. Maybe a bit young though? As I can remember the other samples in this style I had to be deeper and smoother. (On tap at Borefts 2016)
Earthy, herby, not the most flavorful beer but I am very happy I was able to finally have this style on tap at Borefts

Tap at Borefts. Hazy orange golden with no head. Tropical fruits, quite herbal, spruce, sweet grains, a hint of smoke, orange. Very fruity with what seems like quinoa or other weird grains. Medium sweet, light bitter. Medium bodied with no carbonation.
Tap. Murky orange color with white head. Aroma is wheat, spicy, juniper, banana. Taste is more juniper, spices, bananas and wheat. Low carbonation. Classic Sahti I suppose.
Frischer, süß säuerlich hefiger Antrunk. Leicht bitter, kräutrige Noten. Die Hefigkeit bleibt stark. 8/8/9/8//8
@ BBF 2014. Little opaque yellow, only small white lacing foam ring remaining. Light barley aroma, light barley in taste, some hoopy notes. (Bodegraven 201609)
Draft at Borefts, thanks for sharing! Fruity, very sweet, caramel and malts. Not realy my thing.

Sampled from tap at Borefts 2016 day 1. Opaque orange. Sweet toasted malts, spruce, resin, honey, floweriness, tea leaves. Medium sweet, light bitter. Under medium body, soft carbonation. Bittersweet yeasty finish.
